events.name: MOX Singapore Launch Party @The Co.
events.description:
Two months after MOX's second Demo Day in Singapore, we are officially launching our office in Singapore via The Co.! Come enjoy some beer and join other like-minded entrepreneurs, investors and digital nomads building great things. 
 
“The MOX Batch 2 demo day was one of the better ones we have come across.” - e27 
 
 
ABOUT MOX
#1 in Asia: MOX, the “Mobile Only Accelerator”, is run by the same team behind Chinaccelerator, Asia's leading cross-border accelerator and a powerhouse for high caliber startups like BitMex, which grew to become the world's largest bitcoin exchange and won Tech in Asia Singapore Arena 2016. 
 
Unfair Advantage: MOX is on a mission to accelerate best of breed mobile companies into the mobile first, mobile only emerging markets. Every MOX participant receives an unfair advantage from the moment they enter the program as we provide them tens of millions of users at no cost and a network of 250 mentors across the world.
 

 
Global Focus: SOSV, the venture fund behind MOX, is a global fund with $300M assets under management operating world-renowned accelerators in the areas of hardware, software, biology, food, robotics, medical devices, transportation, green energy, and beyond. With MOX's new home in Singapore, we can be the landing pad that launches startups from the region into the world.
 
Only a few spots left for MOX Batch 3. Interested in applying? Visit www.mobileonlyx.com.
 
ABOUT THE CO
The Co. is one of Southeast Asia’s fastest growing entrepreneurial communities, it’s also a premium work experience that uniquely weaves life and business together through an inspired sense of adventure and purpose. Everything we do orientates you towards a successful business adventure. Whether it is connecting you to the best of the neighbourhood, making sure you are in good company or providing quality, design focused facilities, we are committed to your world working well so that you can get get on with your walk.
http://www.jointhe.co/
events.location: The Co., 99 Duxton Rd, Singapore null

events.name: AWS Security & Group Intro
events.description:
Welcome to the first Singapore AWS Security Meetup.  This is a chance for everyone interested in cloud security on AWS to get together, share knowledge and dive-deep on common challenges.  


Agenda: •  Introduction to the new AWS Security Meetup Group • AWS Security 101 -- Myles Hosford will present on an introduction to AWS Security, the shared security model and a quick recap of the native AWS Security services. • Developing on the Cloud - Lessons Learned! - Quan Heng from Horangi.com will be presenting on their journey moving to AWS and the lessons learned from a security perspective. 



Light refreshments will be provided. 


I hope to see you all there!
events.location: AWS Offices Singapore, 23 Church Street, Capital Square #10-01, 049481 Singapore

events.name: YOW! Night: 10 Ways to Accelerate Software Development with Dave Thomas
events.description:
A major dominant concern for most software development is how to increase the productivity of development; evolution and/or execution. Systemic change in process and/or technology seldom result in more than an incremental impact on productivity and ROI. Increased value is best achieved by targeting specific waste/opportunities in the value chain by introducing an innovative solution. In this talk, we describe 10 techniques that are effective in accelerating software development. We discuss how one identifies optimal change points to impact both new and legacy code. Register here 


About Dave ThomasDave Thomas, Chief Scientist/CSO, Kx Systems, Co-Founder and past Chairman of Bedarra Research Labs (BRL), creators of the Ivy visual analytics workbench and ACM Distinguished Engineer. Founder and past CEO of Object Technology International (OTI), becoming CEO of IBM OTI Labs after its sale to IBM. With a unique ability to see the future and translate research into competitive products, he is known for his contributions to Object Technology including IBM VisualAge and Eclipse IDEs, Smalltalk and Java virtual machines. Dave is founder and chairman of the YOW! Australia and Lambda Jam conferences, and is a GOTO Conference Fellow.
events.location: ThoughtWorks , 18 cross street #11-08 China Sq Central (S)048423, Singapore

events.name: Singapore Mobile .Net Developers presents: Xamarin @ Microsoft Build 2017
events.description:
Our may event will take place just a few days after Microsoft Build conference (10-12 May), where a lot of new Xamarin stuff shall be announced. 
So how about we have a recap of all the yet-to-be-announced Xamarin greatness?
We'll fill the details in as soon as we get them!
Be there by 6:30 to enjoy developers favourite food, the same kind that you'd want if you find yourself stranded on a desert island with a mobile pizza bar.
Speakers:
Michael Williams (Technical Solution Professional @ Microsoft)
"Michael is a Full Stack developer with over 8 years experience in Mobile development and 3 years with architectural design in the cloud (Azure, AWS and some Google Cloud). Michael has been working with the Xamarin and the mobile DevOps toolset for 4 years now, he has built applications using both Xamarin Native, Xamarin Forms and hosted back ends via AWS and Azure using CQRS and Event Sourcing. Before Joining Microsoft, Michael worked on projects with 7 companies, including Telstra Health.   In his spare time, he loves to study Physics and Maths, playing piano (primarily Jazz), watching sport, eating food and travelling.  He even studied Jazz at Berklee in Boston." 
• End to End mobile DevOps on VSTS
• Build 2017 Recap - Part I 

Ben Ishiyama-Levy (Xamarin MVP | Microsoft MVP | Director @ Xamariners | MC)
"Likes Xamarin a lot."
• Build 2017 Recap - Part II 

https://www.meetup.com/SingaporeMobileDev/events/238554100/
events.location: Microsoft Singapore, Level 22, Room CF12, one marina boulevard, singapore 018989

events.name: EventSourcing and CQRS with Lagom Microservice Framework
events.description:
Lagom is Lightbend's reactive micro-service framework, with intuitive and simple abstractions for Command Query Responsibility Segregation (CQRS) and Eventsourcing (ES). By modelling changes in an application as only events, they become the only source of truth. The events are then used for constructing current state of the system (in aggregate root), creating optimized view for querying (read-side) and propagating changes to other systems in asynchronous fashion (message-producer). In this talk, we will survey concepts in CQRS and ES, explain why Lagom might be a good candidate for your next micro-service, and highlight how data consistency within and across micro-services is addressed. 



Agenda: 7:00 -- Food & drinks 7:20 -- Meetup group announcements 7:25 -- Venue / event host announcements 7:30 -- Presentation 8:30 -- Q&A  Presenters: Joo Lee, Lead Engineer @ StashAwayJoo has spent last 8 years in finance industry as a software programmer developing front office trading systems for the investment banks like Macquarie, UBS and Goldman Sachs. He recently joined StashAway with the vision of building the accessible, affordable and yet very powerful computerized asset management platform for investors. Mick, Engineer @ StashAwayAfter graduation in 2015, Mick was fortunate to have been mentored and worked with awesome engineers at Redmart. He's now in a small kick-ass team at StashAway, happily coding in Scala, exploring new sets of technologies, and building a great product.
events.location: Lazada, Level 8 AXA Tower, 8 Shenton Way, Singapore 068811

events.name: ArtScience Late: The Garden of the Eye of the Future
events.description:
ArtScience Late: The Garden of the Eye of the Future
Presented by Tim De Cotta
18 May 2017, Thursday | 7pm – 9pm
Lobby, ArtScience Museum
Free

Enter The Garden of the Eye of the Future where music and vision take you into the foreseeable future and all its possible tangents. Close your eyes and embrace the electric dream of robotic vines that harness our chemical potential in dry cell batteries; and neurons intertwined with roots and elemental makeup deep in the ground.

Programmed in celebration of the opening of HUMAN+: The Future of Our Species. Venture to our new exhibition on Basement 2 for a special sneak preview of real and imagined possibilities for the boundaries of the human species. Make up your own mind about what the future holds for us. The rest is up to you.
